subtitle: I’m scared to let my baby go
description: I’m scared to let my baby go
title: TiredMom: Mother-in-law wants to help
content:
Brought to you by MAMA By the time my baby boy was 3 weeks old, I was tired. I
hadn’t slept a full night since the birth. I felt as if my baby only knew how
to do three things: eat, sleep and cry! My mother-in-law saw that I was tired
and tried to help me. She said she would look after him while I lay down for
some rest. I couldn’t refuse. But handing over my tiny newborn felt harder
than hearing him cry! I watched how she held him. I didn’t think that she was
doing it quite right – it wasn’t the way I would do it. Even though I tried to
take a nap, I could hear my baby crying in the next room. I just wanted to go
and take him back! I know mother-in-law was trying to help. And she did a good
job raising her son because my husband is a wonderful man. But I was so
protective. I just wanted to hold my boy and not let him go to anyone else. I
know no harm will come to him, so I am trying to relax when others want to
hold him. But I still get a secret thrill when I see that his smile for me is
the biggest! **MAMA HELP: You’re a new mom – it’s perfectly normal to not want
to let your baby out of your sight. It will get easier in time. When family
members want to hold your baby, try to see it as a good thing. They are
helpful and love her!**
